alert.note: Alert for San Francisco (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 25 at 7:11AM PST until November 25 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding. For the Beach Hazards Statement, increased threat of sneaker waves expected. * WHERE...San Francisco County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. For the Beach Hazards Statement; large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These sneaker waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sneaker wave threat will be highest for west to northwest facing beaches. In addition to the sneaker wave threat, high astronomical tides are also expected this weekend, which can cause further runup along the beaches. Additionally, tidal levels are running a half-foot above predictions and therefore likely to produce minor coastal flooding.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
